meanings.definition: The process by which a seed begins to grow into a new plant.
meanings.sent1: The farmer observed the germination of the seeds in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The garden is full of life thanks to the germination of various seeds.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the teacher joked about the germination of a jellybean plant.
meanings.sent4: The city's development can be likened to the germination of a seed, slowly but steadily growing.
meanings.sent5: The magic of germination transforms a tiny seed into a magnificent plant.

meanings.definition: The act of sprouting or developing.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the germination of new shoots was visible in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The forest thrived with the germination of countless seeds.
meanings.sent3: The germination of a new idea sparked excitement among the team.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the germination of businesses was a common sight.
meanings.sent5: The germination of creativity in young minds is a beautiful sight to behold.
